intro: Anuragia cruciata, commonly known as the crossleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive cross-shaped pattern on the underside.
